Factory¶

Overview¶

Controller factory with Pydantic v2 config alignment and robust error handling.

Examples¶

>>> from src.controllers.factory import *
>>> # Create controller instances using factory methods
>>> controller = create_controller('classical_smc')

API Summary¶

src.controllers.factory

Controller factory with Pydantic v2 config alignment and robust error handling.

Detailed API¶

Controller factory with Pydantic v2 config alignment and robust error handling.

src.controllers.factory.build_controller(name, cfg, *, allow_unknown=False, config=None, gains=None)[source]¶

Build a single controller from configuration.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Controller name (will be normalized and aliased).

  • cfg (dict or Mapping or ControllerConfig) – Controller-specific configuration.

  • allow_unknown (bool) – If True, unknown parameters are stored as unknown_params on the instance. If False, unknown parameters raise FactoryConfigurationError.

  • config (optional) – Full configuration object (for backward compatibility).

  • gains (optional) – Explicit gains override.

Return type:

Controller instance

Raises:

FactoryConfigurationError – If controller name is unknown or configuration is invalid.

src.controllers.factory.build_all(controllers_cfg, *, allow_unknown=False, config=None)[source]¶

Build all controllers from a ControllersConfig.

Parameters:

  • controllers_cfg (ControllersConfig or dict) – Configuration for all controllers.

  • allow_unknown (bool) – If True, unknown parameters are stored on instances. If False, unknown parameters raise errors.

  • config (optional) – Full configuration object for defaults.

Returns:

Mapping of controller names to instances.

Return type:

dict[str, Controller]

Raises:

FactoryConfigurationError – If any controller fails to build (aggregates all errors).

src.controllers.factory.create_controller(name, /, **kwargs)[source]¶

Backwards-compatible convenience wrapper used by tests and the CLI. Delegates to build_controller() so mapping/validation stays centralized.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Controller name (aliases allowed).

  • **kwargs – Per-controller constructor args (e.g., gains, dt, max_force).

Return type:

Any

src.controllers.factory.normalize_controller_name(name)[source]¶

Normalize controller name and apply aliases.

Lowercase, trim, replace hyphens/spaces/dots with underscores, then check alias map.

Parameters:

name (str)

Return type:

str

src.controllers.factory.apply_deprecation_mapping(controller_name, params, allow_unknown=False)[source]¶

Apply deprecation mapping for a controller’s parameters.

Returns normalized params dict with deprecated keys mapped to current ones. Emits DeprecationWarning for each deprecated key found.

Parameters:

  • controller_name (str)

  • params (Dict[str, Any])

  • allow_unknown (bool)

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

src.controllers.factory.register_controller(name)[source]¶

Decorator for registering controller constructors.

Registration is idempotent - re-registering the same name overwrites.

Parameters:

name (str)

Return type:

Callable[[Type[Any]], Type[Any]]

exception src.controllers.factory.FactoryConfigurationError[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Raised when controller configuration or resolution fails.

exception src.controllers.factory.ConfigValueError[source]¶

Bases: ValueError

Raised when a config value is out of the accepted range.

exception src.controllers.factory.UnknownConfigKeyError[source]¶

Bases: ValueError

Raised when unexpected/unknown keys appear in a controller config block.
